section.title: Device status
section.para: Symantec Security Cloud device status lets you know at a glance whether the devices in your network are secure, or whether there are issues that need your attention. You can view a summary of device status across your network on the dashboard. The Compromised and At Risk statuses are also reported as key performance indicators so that you can easily locate the source of insecure devices.

table.title: Table: Device status in Symantec Security Cloud

entry.para: Device enrollment and security scans are in progress.

note.para: After the necessary software is installed, the status of Mac and Windows devices is set to Pending until the first scan has completed.

itemizedlist.title: Device meets all the following criteria:

listitem.para: Current version of the security agent is installed (does not apply to iOS)
Last check-in was less than 72 hours ago
Virus definitions are less than 72 hours old

itemizedlist.title: Device status is not "Compromised", and device meets either of the following criteria:

listitem.para: Virus definitions are more than 72 hours old
Security client is out of date (does not apply to iOS )

entry.para: The device is infected and requires immediate attention.
Device has been unenrolled, by either an administrator or the device owner.

note.para: You can view this status only on the Devices tab. You must explicitly choose the "Unenrolled" status in the Filters drop-down.
